content: stitch 627 pattern - planarian stitch627 s planarian aka flatworm platyhelminthes dugesia this pattern is for creating a simple planarian often referred to as a flatworm or its scientific name platyhelminthes dugesia planaria it can be used as a book marker coaster or for whatever you want click the following links to learn more about planarians http //en wikipedia org/wiki/planarium http //cas bellarmine edu/tietjen/images/platyhelminthes htm skill level easy finished size 10 ¼ length 3 wide materials worsted weight yarns body 1 skein red heart ltd super saver multis/ombres - sandy print 0792 eyes 1 skein lion brand vanna s choice solid white 100 1 skein lion brand wool-ease solid black 153 note you will only need about 25 skein of yarn for the body color and only a yard for each of colors used with the eyes i used some scraps of colors to make mine you can use any colors or type of yarn you want as long as it is worsted weight you can also use small buttons for eyes if you wish tools crochet hook size j blunt tip needle for stitching eyes gauge is not important for this project 21-apr-08 1 stitch 627 pattern - planarian stitch explanation s decrease single_crochet decrease - insert hook into st and draw up a loop insert hook into next st and draw up a loop yarn over draw through all 3 loops on hook chain = chain or chain stitch single_crochet = single_crochet increase = increase note the only tricky part is in row #36 where you will increase stitches at the end of the row by making additional chain stitches chain and in row #37 where you will increase stitches at the end of the row by making external increase row #37 is done by inserting the hook into the base of the last stitch made yarn over hook and pull through stitch you will create 3 of these in a row many crochet books can illustrate how this is done or more information and an illustration can be found in the essential book of crochet techniques by nancie m wiseman let s begin using body color chain 2 row 1 2sc in 1st chain 2sc row 2 chain 1 turn single_crochet in each single_crochet across 2sc row 3 chain 1 turn single_crochet in each single_crochet across 2sc row 4 chain 1 turn single_crochet in each single_crochet across 2sc row 5 chain 1 turn single_crochet in 1st single_crochet 2sc in 2nd single_crochet 3sc row 6 chain 1 turn single_crochet in each single_crochet across 3sc row 7 chain 1 turn single_crochet in each single_crochet with 2sc in last single_crochet 4sc row 8 chain 1 turn single_crochet in each single_crochet across 4sc row 9 chain 1 turn single_crochet in each single_crochet across 4sc row 10 chain 1 turn single_crochet in each single_crochet across 4sc row 11 chain 1 turn single_crochet in each single_crochet with 2sc in last single_crochet 5sc row 12 chain 1 turn single_crochet in each single_crochet across 5sc
